Detailed Description

Text input stream abstraction.

gTextStream is an abstraction which allows the tokenizer to access text from a file or memory through the same buffered interface.

Define Documentation

#define gFreeStream ( txtstrm   )     txtstrm->freestream(txtstrm)

Frees a gTextStream.

Frees txtstrm. If the stream is a memory buffer, the memory is freed. If the stream is a file, the filestream is clused.

#define gGetChar ( txtstrm   )     txtstrm->ggetchar(txtstrm)

Gets a character.

Returns the next character from txtstrm and increments the file/memory pointer. Returns 0 on EOF

#define gReadahead ( txtstrm,
count   )     txtstrm->readahead(txtstrm, count)

Reads a string from a stream.

Returns a pointer to a string containing the next (count) number of characters from the given stream. If the stream is exhausted, the remainder is returned. (returns NULL on EOF). This function is a read-ahead function and does not increment the stream pointer.

#define gReadChar ( txtstrm   )     txtstrm->readchar(txtstrm)

Reads a character.

Returns the next character from txtstrm but does not increment the file/memory pointer. Returns 0 on EOF

#define gSeek ( txtstrm,
offset   )     txtstrm->seek(txtstrm, offset)

Seek ahead or behind in a stream.

Seeks ahead or behind by offset the given number of characters in stream.

int  pos 
)

Seek to a position in the stream.

Seeks an absolute position within the stream.

Parameters:
[in] stream Stream to seek within
[in] pos Position within the stream.

bool gStreamEnd ( gTextStream *  stream  ) 

Detects end of stream.

Returns:
true of the stream has reached the end of the buffer/file.

gTextStream * gStreamFromFilename ( const char *  filename  ) 

gTextStream from a filename.

Opens a file and creates a gTextStream from the handle.

Parameters:
[in] filename Name of the file to open and stream.
Returns:
New gTextStream on success, NULL on failure (failed to open file)

gTextStream * gStreamFromMemory ( char *  memory,
int  length,
bool  owner 
)

gTextStream from a memory buffer.

Creates a text stream from a memory buffer. It is important to pass an accurate length value because a memory stream only has this value to find the end of the stream.

Parameters:
[in] memory The memory buffer to stream from
[in] length Length of the memory buffer.
[in] owner If set to true, gFreeStream will free the memory buffer.
Returns:
New gTextStream, NULL on failure
